resources.string: NC Quiz
readme
close

I call this quiz NC. If you are german, don't worry. There is nothing to do with the Numerus Clausus, not with exams at all. Its name is Nerd Check. It's a small quiz to check how nerd you are :) Or let's say there are some funny questions for you to entertain:) 
There are some questions where you can only choice 1 unique answer(with circle) and some you can choose more(with square). 
Pay attention to the question before you head any answer 
Press submit if you are sure about the answer. Submit will block you from that question since it will show you the answer after pressing 
If you don't have enough time to see the answer. Don't worry, you can take a look at all the QA at the end Press <<see QA>> button at the end to see all the answer with explanation 
Ok. Enough text. I hope you have fun checking your nerd level 
Stay foolish. Stay hungry. 
Be passionate. Be curious. 
Be a nerd 
L3I2

Question 6
What is the answer to life, the universum and everything?
Which droids are in the movie Star wars?(choose 1 or more)
There is no place like ...
Which of those answers are not heavier than 1kg iron?(choose 1 or more)
200gram sugar and 800gram iron
1kg gold
1kg silver
half of kg water and half of kg gold
There are ... types of people in the world; those who understand binary and those who do not
The only valid measurement of code quality is ..../minute
type what you think, do not worry about the word case
submit
\nANSWER: 42 is known as the answer to life, universum and everything since the movie <<The Hitchhiker\'s Guide to the Galaxy>>
\nANSWER: C3PO(image 2), R2D2(image 3) and BB8(image 4) are from star wars, Marvin (image 1) is as know as <<the most depressive robot>> from the movie <<The Hitchhiker\'s Guide to the Galaxy>>
\nANSWER: <<127.0.0.1>> is known as <<local host>> or <<home address>> in computer network. Of course there is no place like <<home>>
\nANSWER: Sorry for kidding you like this. Of course 1kg is always 1kg no matter in water or sugar or iron or gold=)))
\nANSWER: One group knows binary and one doesn\'t. It should be 2, shouldn\'t it? And 2 in binary is <<10>>

\nANSWER: Have you ever said <<What the fuck>> while reading someone\'s code. When you read a code, and have to say <<WTF>> the whole time, that means it\'s not a good code. Number of <<What the fuck>>/minute is known as a measurement for code style
what the fuck/wtf/wtfs/WTF/WTFs/whatthefuck
you are quite nerdy. Be nerdier.
wow you are very nerdy. Stay nerdy.
wow you are born to be nerd.
